name: Daimons
summary: Purplish-skinned amorphous monsters that are forms of life native to the Tau Ceti Star System, who act as minions of the main antagonists of the third arc, the Death Busters.

name: Daleks
summary: Mutated squid-like lifeforms inside tank-like war machines. Xenophobic and power-hungry, they have repeatedly threatened the universe and are the most recurring enemies of the Doctor.

name: Dark Eldar
summary: Humanoid pirates dedicated to sadism and depravity.

name: Decapodian
summary: Lobster people.  Bright red, with tentacles over their mouths.  When they mate, they die horribly.

name: Decepticon
summary: Faction of Cybertronians who are opposed to the Autobots. Ill intent for human race.

name: Deep Ones
summary: Fish-like humanoids who serve and worship the Great Old Ones known as Father Dagon and Mother Hydra.

name: Delphons
source: The History of the Galaxy series

name: Delvians
summary: Humanoid - Similar to humans in appearance, but evolved from plants. Blue, bald, sensitive to sunlight, procreate through air-borne spores.

name: Dentics
summary: Gastropod / Slug-like.  Symbiotic relationship, used for dental hygiene purposes: This small animal thoroughly cleans the teeth of the user in a short amount of time.

name: Dentrassis
source: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
summary: Dedicated chefs who "don't give a wet slap about anything else".

name: Dilbians
source: The Law-Twister Shorty and other stories by Gordon Dickson

name: Dirdir
source: Jack Vance's Planet of Adventure Series

name: Do Seo-joon
summary: A humanoid character pulled out this TV show

name: Dominators
summary: Ruthless humanoid conquerors; served by robotic Quarks.

name: DomZ
summary: Parasitic, energy-draining creatures with a skeletal/insectoid appearance. Come in various forms, including Sarcophagii, Spirit-Eaters and the DomZ High Priest.

name: Doog
summary: Reptiloid with canine features. Extremely dull-witted.

name: Doraemon (Parallel Planet on the contrary)
summary: Robot who is gender-swapped version of Doraemon

name: Dracs
source: Barry B. Longyear's Enemy Mine and The Enemy Papers

name: Draconians
summary: Reptilian humanoids with an interstellar empire rivalling that of Earth.

name: Draenei
summary: Seven-foot-tall blue humanoids with cloven hooves for feet, reptilian tails, and barbels.

name: Drej
summary: Composed of pure energy, these aliens are a powerful force and are capable of destroying whole planets if they see fit. Ruled by a Queen.

name: Drones (Yanme'e)
summary: Flying creatures, appear insectoid. Part of Covenant Hierarchy, ill intent towards humans.

name: Dubtaks
summary: large manta-like creature that move on a multitude of wormlike legs

name: Durlans
summary: A mass of tentacles in robes.
